channel.title: Help me pick a laptop
channel.description:
Well i just started year 11 at school (different from america but basically its my last year of highschool in which i have to do coursework and exams). I got home from my first day and its obvious if i'm to do my best i'm going to need a laptop. Luckily earlier today my mum got a phone call from the gas company saying they over charged her £500 by accident. So she decided that we shall get a laptop (she needs to use it to check her email and such, and i can use it for school).
So moparfans what is the best laptop i can get for £500? (I may be able to stretch it to £600).
I know its not much money but i need a laptop no matter how fast it is.
I will be using it for - - Photo/paintshop (for design tech work). - talking on msn - browsing internet - not really for playing games.
So what is the most reliable laptop i can get for that amount of money?
Btw - yes im willing to buy online and yes i will buy for USD which is: 500.00 GBP = 1,013.86 USD 600.00 GBP = 1,216.63 USD
Thanks!
edit - oh also will probably be learning/programming java on it too incase you want to know.

item.title: Help me pick a laptop
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Hey thanks everyone for your support, and sorry i havent posted in a few days (school has been in the way).
Also thanks for the mods who warned gikid (sorry gikid but posts like that arent helpful, even if vista does suck ass).

I just this moment ordered a laptop from www.novatech.com - i nearly always buy stuff from there, i dont know why but everything seems such good value, bought a laptop for £445.00 which is well under my budget which my mother was very happy about. Here is a link to the one i bought which will be arriving on friday, please post comments about it:
http://www.novatech.co.uk/novatech/nbrange.html?RAS (the cheaper one)

Read full topic

@ice123 wrote:

The best is Toshiba: Windows Vista. Thats what im using right now Windows vista Premium and that cost $800 or more but if u are getting mircosoft office that will cost $200 so if u dont want microsoft office it will just be $800.

Thats the best Laptop u can get i think lol the C: holds 110 GB.

I found u a laptop that ahs the Windows Vista Premium k

Link----- http://www.toshibadirect.com/td/b2c/pdet.to?seg=HHO&poid=383251

item.title: Help me pick a laptop
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

http://www.widowpc.com/2006/05/sting_215d_ligh.php

http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&q=custom+gaming+laptops tbh

I just did my own search and found this laptop

http://www.xtremenotebooks.com/index.php?section=configurator&regular_model_id=1123&model_id=1124&include_type=centrino&category=

So for the upgrades, choose these:

CPU:
Intel® T5600 (1.83GHz x 2) Core 2 Duo CPU with 2MB On-Die L2 Cache 667MHz FSB + $100.00

RAM:
SALE! 2048MB 667MHz Corsair DDR2 (2x1024MB) + $110.00 (Corsair is the best RAM out there)

Hard Drive:
120GB SATA 150/HDD 7200 RPM + $80.00

Which brings the total to $1329, just about your price range =). Only problem is that it’s $200 more, and less powerful, so I shop around a bit more for you.

AND ANOTHER!

http://www.xoticpc.com/product_info.php?wconfigure=yes&products_id=1876

Get it with these:

XOTIC / SAGER NP2090 ( COMPAL IFL90 ) Intel Core 2 DUO / 15.4" WS/XGA / 512MB PCI-Express GeForce 8600GT Video / DDR2 667 / SATA (BACK ORDRED 3-6 Weeks) XOTIC / SAGER NP2090 ( COMPAL IFL90 ) Intel Core 2 DUO / 15.4" WS/XGA / 512MB PCI-Express GeForce 8600GT Video / DDR2 667 / SATA (BACK ORDRED 3-6 Weeks)

  • 15.4" WXGA “Glare Type” Super Clear Ultra Bright Glossy Screen (1280x800)
  • Arctic Silver 5 Thermal Compound
  • Standard Dead Pixel Policy
  • ~Intel® Core™2 Duo T7250 2.0GHz w/2MB L2 On-die cache - 800MHz FSB
  • 512MB PCI-Express nVidia GeForce 8600GT DX10
  • None Standard
  • ~ 2,048MB DDR2 667 PC2 5300 (2 SODIMMS) Dual Channel Memory
  • None Standard
  • Standard Finish
    • Combo Dual Layer SuperMulti 8X DVDRW Drive w/ Software
  • ~ 80GB 7200RPM (Serial-ATA 150)
  • None Standard
  • Internal 4-in-1 Card Reader (SD/MMC/MS/MS PRO)
  • Built in 2.0 Megapixel Camera
  • None Standard
  • Sound Blaster Compatible 3D Audio - Included
  • Integrated System Speakers - Included
  • None Standard
  • Built-in Intel® PRO/Wireless 4965 802.11 a/g/n
  • None Standard
  • Carying Case Optional (Select if desired)
  • Smart Li-ion Battery (9-Cell)
  • 110/220V 120W Auto Switching AC Adapter - Included
  • None Standard
  • None Standard
  • None Standard
  • Integrated Fingerprint Reader
  • None Standard
  • None Standard
  • None Standard - Drivers & Utility Software Only
  • None Standard
  • None Standard
  • 3 Year Labor* 1 Year Parts Warranty Lifetime Toll Free Tech Support (Extra 2 Year Labor Warranty through Xotic PC)

This one is better, and its around $1200, i forgot to check and I closed the tab =[.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me pick a laptop
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I have been looking around www.ibuypower.com and they seem to do the best performance laptops in my price range.
for $1165 you get:
2 X 2.2ghz intel duo mobile
2GB memory with the option to upgrade to 4GB
Geforce 8600
120GB hard drive
and all the usual stuff.
also comes with a free carry case.
unlike other major brands (E.g. dell) it is optional for it to come with windows.

I just emailed the tech support people there and asked if they ship to the UK because i can’t find it saying it wont on the website (apart from when you go through the shopping cart)

and RXVL that would be great but my mum would not let me trust someone i met over the internet like that. but thanks very much for the offer!

Also thanks 1337h4x, my sister has an acer and it isnt that bad.

Also quick question how long do you think the battery for this would last:

ibuypower.com

Gaming PC Desktops / Custom Computers: iBUYPOWER®

High performance gaming PCs at a low price. Click now to customize your processor, memory, video card, and more.

thanks

Ok they replied to my email and said they do not ship to the UK. GRRR
so i’m looking for something about 500-600£ ($1000-$1200) with this:

[code]
Processor Support Intel® Merom FSB800 CPU T7100/7300/7500/7700
Chipset Intel® PM965 + ICH8-M
Graphics & Video Module Mobility 256 NVIDIA® GeForce GO 8600GT PCI-Express 3D Video
Main Memory DDR2 667 SO-DIMM x 2 slots, MAX: 4GB
Display 15.4" WXGA ( 1280 x 800 )
PC Cards Slot x1
Card Reader SD/MMC/MS/MS-Pro 4-in-1 Card Reader
Hard Disk Drive Supports SATA HDDSupports SATA HDD
Optical Drive Build-In DVD+/-RW
LAN/Modem Realtek Gigabit LAN + 56K Modem
Wireless LAN Supports Intel® PCI-Express mini card 4965 & 3945
Security Function None
Built-in CMOS Camera 2.0 Mega Pixels
I/O Ports
• USB 2.0 : 4
• IEEE 1394 : 1
• MIC-in : 1
• Headphone out : 1
• RJ11 : 1
• RJ45 : 1
• TV-Out : S-Video x 1
Audio Realtek ALC 888H
Battery Pack & Life Li-ion battery
AC Adapter 19V DC, 110~240V AC, 50/60Hz universal
Dimension

355mm(W) x 257mm(D)x 35.2mm(H)

Weight 6.6 lbs[/code]
if you cba to read the above basically:
a geforce 8600 graphics card (go)
at least 2GB of ram
and at least a 2 X 2GHZ processor

ty

Read full topic

can anyone find something like this that ships to UK?
http://www.ibuypower.com/ibp/store/configurator.aspx?mid=256[/quote]

I could strike a deal with you, even though it would sound odd, you can get it shipped to me, and I could ship it to you. I don’t know how much shipping is from New Jersey to the UK.

item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Get a HP dv2500t with these upgrades:

Operating system Genuine Windows Vista Home Premium (32-bit)
edit

Processor Intel® Core™ 2 Duo processor T5250 (1.5 GHz, 2MB L2 Cache, 667MHz FSB)
edit

Display 14.1" WXGA High-Definition HP BrightView Widescreen Display (1280 x 800)
edit

Memory 2GB DDR2 System Memory (2 Dimm)
edit

Graphics Card 319MB NVIDIA GeForce 8400M GS
edit

Personalization HP Imprint (Radiance) + Fingerprint Reader + Webcam + Microphone
edit

Networking Intel® PRO/Wireless 3945ABG Network Connection
edit

Hard Drive FREE Upgrade to 160GB 5400RPM from 120GB 5400RPM!!
edit

Primary CD/DVD Drive SuperMulti 8X DVD+/-R/RW with Double Layer Support
edit

TV & Entertainment Experience No TV Tuner w/remote control
edit

Primary Battery High Capacity 6 Cell Lithium Ion Battery
edit
